meanings.definition: Demand or specify as part of an agreement or contract.
meanings.sent1: The contract stipulated a deadline for completion.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stipulate all terms clearly in the agreement.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly stipulated that only purple pens could be used for signing.
meanings.sent4: His strict diet stipulated no sugar or carbs, making it challenging.
meanings.sent5: The teacher stipulated that homework must be turned in by 9 a.m. sharp.

meanings.definition: Specify a condition or requirement in an agreement.
meanings.sent1: The document stipulated that all employees must attend the training.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to stipulate any additional costs in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The party invitation stipulated that guests must wear costumes.
meanings.sent4: The rules stipulated by the coach were followed diligently by the team.
meanings.sent5: She stipulated that the project must be completed by Friday without fail.

meanings.definition: Agree to a specific condition or requirement.
meanings.sent1: He stipulated to the terms of the lease before signing.
meanings.sent2: They stipulated to the conditions set forth by the committee.
meanings.sent3: The siblings stipulated to take turns using the computer.
meanings.sent4: She stipulated to the demands of the job to secure the position.
meanings.sent5: The company stipulated to the client's request for a customized product.
